com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.shared.clients

Class AbstractConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.shared.clients.AbstractConnection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Loggable, Mutex, Connection
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TCPDefaultConnection, UDPDefaultConnection

    @Tested(responsibleTest="com.github.thorbenkuck.netcom2.network.shared.clients.AbstractConnectionTest")
public abstract class AbstractConnection
extends Object
implements Connection, Mutex
    This Abstract Connection makes it easier for you, to create a custom Connection
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0

      • beforeSend

        protected abstract void beforeSend(Object o)
        This method is called, before an Object is sent to the client.
        Parameters:
        o - the Object

      • onClose

        protected abstract void onClose()
        This method is only called, if the Connection is closed.

        To be exact, it will be called AFTER the closing routing

      • afterSend

        protected abstract void afterSend(Object o)
        This method is called, after an Object has been sent
        Parameters:
        o - the Object that was just sent.

      • setLogging

        public void setLogging(Logging logging)
        Allows to override internally set Logging-instances.

        By default, every component uses the Logging.unified(), therefore, by calling:

        Logging instance = ... NetComLogging.setLogging(instance);

        you will update the internally used logging mechanisms of all components at the same time.

        Specified by:
        setLogging in interface Loggable
        Parameters:
        logging - the Logging instance that should be used.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Closes the Connection.

        This will close the underlying connection-type. In the case of the AbstractConnection, this is the Socket.

        It may throw an IOException, if anything goes wrong while closing the Connection.

        Specified by:
        close in interface Connection
        Throws:
        IOException

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Sets up internal dependencies.

        Depending on the implementation, this requires an already established connection to the source.

        In the case of the AbstractConnection, this means it creates the SendingService and ReceivingService, that listen on the Connection and handles send/received Objects.

        Specified by:
        setup in interface Connection

      • removeOnDisconnectedConsumer

        public void removeOnDisconnectedConsumer(java.util.function.Consumer<Connection> consumer)
        Removes an set Consumer, that is called once the Connection disconnects.
        Specified by:
        removeOnDisconnectedConsumer in interface Connection
        Parameters:
        consumer - the Consumer, that should be removed.
        See Also:
        Client.addDisconnectedHandler(DisconnectedHandler), Connection.addOnDisconnectedConsumer(Consumer)

      • write

        @Asynchronous
public void write(Object object)
        Writes an Object to this Connection.

        This means the Object is send "to the other side of the Connection". In fact, an Connection is only the entry/exit point. So writing an Connection means, it will be received by another instance of the same type, which represents the corresponding exit point.

        This method is used by the Client.

        Specified by:
        write in interface Connection
        Parameters:
        object - the Object that should be send over the Connection.
        See Also:
        Client.send(Object), Client.send(Class, Object), Client.send(Connection, Object)

      • addObjectSendListener

        public void addObjectSendListener(Callback<Object> callback)
        Adds a listener, that will be called once an Object, added with Connection.write(Object), was successfully send.
        Specified by:
        addObjectSendListener in interface Connection
        Parameters:
        callback - the Callback, that should be called, once the Object is called.

      • addObjectReceivedListener

        public void addObjectReceivedListener(Callback<Object> callback)
        Adds an listener, that will be called once a Object, was received.

        These Callback will be triggered after the CommunicationRegistration is finished to handel the received Object.

        Specified by:
        addObjectReceivedListener in interface Connection
        Parameters:
        callback - the Callback, that should be called, once a Object is received.

      • addOnDisconnectedConsumer

        public com.github.thorbenkuck.keller.pipe.PipelineCondition<Connection> addOnDisconnectedConsumer(java.util.function.Consumer<Connection> consumer)
        Adds an Consumer, that should be trigger, once this Connection disconnects.

        All of those consumers are executed within an Pipeline.

        Specified by:
        addOnDisconnectedConsumer in interface Connection
        Parameters:
        consumer - the Consumer, that should consume this Connection, once this Connection is disconnected.
        Returns:
        an PipelineCondition, that you may use to state whether or not the Consumer should be executed.

      • getSendInterface

        public BlockingQueue<Object> getSendInterface()
        Description copied from interface: Connection
        Returns the Object sending queue.

        Objects are added to this BlockingQueue. If you want to just dump any Object into this Connection, you may use this. The SendingService will take this Object (sooner or later) and send it.

        Note, that no Callback will be added.

        Specified by:
        getSendInterface in interface Connection
        Returns:
        an internally maintained send interface in the type of an BlockingQueue.

      • acquire

        public void acquire()
             throws InterruptedException
        Acquires access over the object. If any other Object has access over the given Object, this Methods waits until the current owner calls release.
        Specified by:
        acquire in interface Mutex
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the waiting takes to long.
